snippet: Polls show that President Obama holds a thin cushion against economic and political woes in many states: minority voters and the shape-shifting November electorate.
abstract: Political Memo; demographic changes in competitive states, particularly the growing number of minority voters, add another variable to the presidential campaign that might offer a thin cushion for Pres Obama as he struggles to maintain the level of support he garnered in 2008 amid economic and political woes.
lead_paragraph: Polls show that President Obama holds a thin cushion against economic and political woes in many states: minority voters and the shape-shifting November electorate.

headline.main: Demographic Shifts in Key States Could Aid Obama in Fall
headline.print_headline: Demographic Shifts in Key States Could Aid Obama in Fall
